Title: Security contact information should be provided for an AWS account
Statement: Take the contact information (name, email, adress,...) from the payer account (master account).  Loop through all the child accounts and if they do not have contact information filled out, set it to the same as the master account

Title: AWS accounts should be part of an AWS Organizations organization
Statement: Ensure that the AWS account is  part of an AWS Organizations organization, otherwise ask for which org to join and then join it.

Title: Imported and ACM-issued certificates should be renewed after a specified time period
Statement: Check all imported and ACM-issued certificates regularly, and renew them before they expire.

Title: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API execution logging should be enabled
API Gateway REST API stages should be configured to use SSL certificates for backend authentication
API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled
API Gateway should be associated with a WAF Web ACL
API Gateway REST API cache data should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Review API Gateway REST API cache data and enable encryption at rest if needed.

Title: API Gateway routes should specify an authorization type
Access logging should be configured for API Gateway V2 Stages
Auto Scaling groups associated with a Classic Load Balancer should use load balancer health checks
Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group should cover multiple Availability Zones
Auto Scaling group launch configurations should configure EC2 instances to require Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
Statement: Check Auto Scaling group launch configurations and modify to require EC2 instances to use IMDSv2.

Title: Auto Scaling group launch configuration should not have a metadata response hop limit greater than 1
Statement: Review all Auto Scaling group launch configurations and set the metadata response hop limit to no greater than 1.

Title: Amazon EC2 instances launched using Auto Scaling group launch configurations should not have Public IP addresses
Statement: Review Auto Scaling group launch configurations to ensure that Amazon EC2 instances do not have Public IP addresses.

Title: Auto Scaling groups should use multiple instance types in multiple Availability Zones
EC2 Auto Scaling groups should use EC2 launch templates
CloudFormation stacks should be integrated with Simple Notification Service (SNS)
CloudFront distributions should have a default root object configured
CloudFront distributions should have origin access identity enabled
CloudFront distributions should require encryption in transit
CloudFront distributions should have origin failover configured
CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled
Statement: Review all CloudFront distributions and enable logging if needed.

Title: CloudFront distributions should have WAF enabled
CloudFront distributions should use custom SSL/TLS certificates
CloudFront distributions should use SNI to serve HTTPS requests
Statement: Ensure that CloudFront distributions are configured to use SNI for serving HTTPS requests.

Title: CloudFront distributions should encrypt traffic to custom origins
Statement: Review CloudFront distributions and enable encryption of traffic to custom origins if needed.

Title: CloudFront distributions should not use deprecated SSL protocols between edge locations and custom origins
CloudFront distributions should not point to non-existent S3 origins
Statement: Review all CloudFront distributions and ensure they are not pointing to non-existent S3 origins.

Title: CloudTrail should be enabled and configured with at least one multi-Region trail that includes read and write management events
Statement: Check to ensure CloudTrail is enabled and properly configured with a multi-Region trail that captures read and write management events.

Title: CloudTrail should have encryption at-rest enabled
Statement: Review CloudTrail and enable encryption at-rest if needed.

Title: CloudTrail should be enabled
Statement: Review CloudTrail and enable if not already enabled.

Title: CloudTrail log file validation should be enabled
Statement: Review CloudTrail log file settings and turn on log file validation if needed.

Title: CloudTrail trails should be integrated with Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Ensure the S3 bucket used to store CloudTrail logs is not publicly accessible
Ensure S3 bucket access logging is enabled on the CloudTrail S3 bucket
A log metric filter and alarm should exist for usage of the "root" user
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for unauthorized API calls
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for Management Console sign-in without MFA
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for IAM policy changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for CloudTrail configuration changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Management Console authentication failures
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMKs
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for S3 bucket policy changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Config configuration changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for security group changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to Network Access Control Lists (NACL)
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to network gateways
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for route table changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for VPC changes
CloudWatch alarms should have an action configured for the ALARM state
CloudWatch log groups should be retained for at least 1 year
CloudWatch alarm actions should be activated
CodeBuild GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URLs should use OAuth
CodeBuild project environment variables should not contain clear text credentials
CodeBuild S3 logs should be encrypted
Statement: Ensure that all CodeBuild S3 logs are encrypted to protect sensitive information.

Title: CodeBuild project environments should have a logging configuration
CodeBuild project environments should not have privileged mode enabled
Statement: Check all CodeBuild project environments and disable privileged mode if it is enabled.

Title: AWS Config should be enabled
Statement: Review AWS Config and turn it on if needed

Title: Database Migration Service replication instances should not be public
DynamoDB tables should automatically scale capacity with demand
DynamoDB tables should have point-in-time recovery enabled
Statement: Review all DynamoDB tables and enable point-in-time recovery if needed.

Title: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Review all DAX clusters and enable encryption at rest if needed.

Title: DynamoDB tables should be covered by a backup plan
EBS snapshots should not be publicly restorable
Statement: Review all EBS snapshots and disable public restore if enabled.

Title: The VPC default security group should not allow inbound and outbound traffic
Statement: Review the VPC default security group and ensure that inbound and outbound traffic is not allowed.

Title: Attached EBS volumes should be encrypted at-rest
Statement: Review all attached EBS volumes and enable encryption at-rest if needed.

Title: Stopped EC2 instances should be removed after a specified time period
Statement: Implement a script or automation to terminate EC2 instances after a specified time period of being stopped.

Title: VPC flow logging should be enabled in all VPCs
Statement: Review all VPCs and enable flow logging if not already enabled.

Title: EBS default encryption should be enabled
Statement: Check EBS settings and make sure default encryption is turned on.

Title: EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
EC2 instances should not have a public IPv4 address
Amazon EC2 should be configured to use VPC endpoints that are created for the Amazon EC2 service
Statement: Review Amazon EC2 configuration and configure VPC endpoints for EC2 service.

Title: Unused EC2 EIPs should be removed
Statement: Review all EC2 instances and release any unused EIPs.

Title: Security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
Statement: Check all security groups and ensure that port 22 is not open to incoming traffic from 0.0.0.0/0.

Title: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389
Statement: Review all security groups and remove any inbound rules that allow traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389.

Title: EC2 subnets should not automatically assign public IP addresses
Statement: Disable automatic public IP address assignment for all EC2 subnets.

Title: Unused Network Access Control Lists should be removed
Statement: Review all Network Access Control Lists and remove any that are not in use.

Title: EC2 instances should not use multiple ENIs
Statement: Review all EC2 instances and remove any additional ENIs that are not necessary to reduce the attack surface.

Title: Security groups should only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
Statement: Review all security groups and ensure that only authorized ports have unrestricted incoming traffic allowed.

Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted access to ports with high risk
Statement: Review all security groups and ensure that ports with high risk are not open to unrestricted access.

Title: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up
Statement: Check the AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection and bring both VPN tunnels up.

Title: Network ACLs should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
Statement: Review network ACLs and remove any inbound rules that allow connections from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389.

Title: Unused EC2 security groups should be removed
Statement: Review all EC2 security groups and remove any that are not in use.

Title: EC2 Transit Gateways should not automatically accept VPC attachment requests
Statement: Review EC2 Transit Gateway settings to ensure that VPC attachment requests are not automatically accepted.

Title: EC2 paravirtual instance types should not be used
Statement: Review all EC2 instances and switch to HVM instance types if needed to avoid using paravirtual instance types.

Title: EC2 launch templates should not assign public IPs to network interfaces
EBS volumes should be covered by a backup plan
EC2 instances should be launched in a VPC
ECR private repositories should have image scanning configured
ECR private repositories should have tag immutability configured
ECR repositories should have at least one lifecycle policy configured
Amazon ECS task definitions should have secure networking modes and user definitions.
ECS services should not have public IP addresses assigned to them automatically
ECS task definitions should not share the host's process namespace
ECS containers should run as non-privileged
ECS containers should be limited to read-only access to root filesystems
Secrets should not be passed as container environment variables
ECS Fargate services should run on the latest Fargate platform version
Statement: Make sure all ECS Fargate services are running on the latest platform version available.

Title: ECS clusters should use Container Insights
Statement: Review all ECS clusters and enable Container Insights if not already enabled.

Title: Elastic File System should be configured to encrypt file data at-rest using AWS KMS
Statement: Review Elastic File System configurations and enable encryption at-rest using AWS KMS if not already enabled.

Title: Amazon EFS volumes should be in backup plans
Statement: Include all Amazon EFS volumes in backup plans for disaster recovery purposes.

Title: EFS access points should enforce a root directory
Statement: Review all EFS access points and configure them to enforce a root directory.

Title: EFS access points should enforce a user identity
Statement: Review all EFS access points and configure them to enforce user identity.

Title: EKS cluster endpoints should not be publicly accessible
Statement: Ensure that EKS cluster endpoints are not accessible outside of the private network.

Title: EKS clusters should run on a supported Kubernetes version
Statement: Ensure that all EKS clusters are running on a version of Kubernetes that is officially supported by AWS.

Title: ElastiCache Redis clusters should have automatic backup enabled
Statement: Check all ElastiCache Redis clusters and enable automatic backup if not already enabled.

Title: ElastiCache for Redis cache clusters should have auto minor version upgrades enabled
Statement: Review ElastiCache for Redis cache clusters to ensure auto minor version upgrades are enabled.

Title: ElastiCache replication groups should have automatic failover enabled
Statement: Review all ElastiCache replication groups and enable automatic failover if needed.

Title: ElastiCache replication groups should have encryption-at-rest enabled
Statement: Check all ElastiCache replication groups and enable encryption-at-rest as necessary.

Title: ElastiCache replication groups should have encryption-in-transit enabled
Statement: Review all ElastiCache replication groups and enable encryption-in-transit if needed.

Title: ElastiCache replication groups of earlier Redis versions should have Redis AUTH enabled
Statement: Review all ElastiCache replication groups of earlier Redis versions and enable Redis AUTH if needed.

Title: ElastiCache clusters should not use the default subnet group
Statement: When creating an ElastiCache cluster, create a custom subnet group and do not use the default one.

Title: Elastic Beanstalk environments should have enhanced health reporting enabled
Statement: Review Elastic Beanstalk environments and enable enhanced health reporting.

Title: Elastic Beanstalk managed platform updates should be enabled
Statement: Review Elastic Beanstalk settings to ensure that managed platform updates are enabled.

Title: Application Load Balancer should be configured to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
Statement: Review the ALB configuration and set up redirection of all HTTP requests to HTTPS.

Title: Classic Load Balancers with SSL/HTTPS listeners should use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
Statement: Check SSL/HTTPS listeners on Classic Load Balancers and use certificates from AWS Certificate Manager if not already in use.

Title: Classic Load Balancer listeners should be configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
Statement: Review all Classic Load Balancer listeners and configure HTTPS or TLS termination if not already enabled.

Title: Application Load Balancer should be configured to drop http headers
Statement: Review the Application Load Balancer settings and configure it to drop http headers.

Title: Application and Classic Load Balancers logging should be enabled
Statement: Review all Application and Classic Load Balancers and enable logging if needed.

Title: Application Load Balancer deletion protection should be enabled
Statement: Review all Application Load Balancers and enable deletion protection if not already enabled.

Title: Classic Load Balancers should have connection draining enabled
Statement: Review all Classic Load Balancers and turn on connection draining if needed.

Title: Classic Load Balancers with SSL listeners should use a predefined security policy that has strong configuration
Classic Load Balancers should have cross-zone load balancing enabled
Classic Load Balancer should span multiple Availability Zones
Application Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Statement: Ensure that the Application Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

Title: Application, Network and Gateway Load Balancers should span multiple Availability Zones
Classic Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Statement: Review Classic Load Balancer configuration and enable defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode if needed.

Title: Application Load Balancers should be associated with an AWS WAF web ACL
Statement: Review all Application Load Balancers and associate them with an AWS WAF web ACL if not already done.

Title: Amazon Elastic MapReduce cluster master nodes should not have public IP addresses
Statement: Review all Amazon Elastic MapReduce cluster master nodes and remove any public IP addresses.

Title: Elasticsearch domains should have encryption at-rest enabled
Statement: Review all Elasticsearch domains and enable encryption at-rest if needed.

Title: Elasticsearch domains should be in a VPC
Elasticsearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
Statement: Review all Elasticsearch domains and ensure that data is encrypted when sent between nodes.

Title: Elasticsearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
Statement: Review Elasticsearch domain configuration and enable error logging to CloudWatch Logs if needed.

Title: Elasticsearch domains should have audit logging enabled
Statement: Review all Elasticsearch domains and enable audit logging if needed.

Title: Elasticsearch domains should have at least three data nodes
Elasticsearch domains should be configured with at least three dedicated master nodes
Connections to Elasticsearch domains should be encrypted using TLS 1.2
Statement: Ensure that all connections to Elasticsearch domains are encrypted using TLS 1.2 protocol.

Title: GuardDuty should be enabled
Statement: Review GuardDuty and enable it if needed.

Title: IAM policies should not allow full "*" administrative privileges
IAM users should not have IAM policies attached
IAM users' access keys should be rotated every 90 days or less
IAM root user access key should not exist
MFA should be enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
Hardware MFA should be enabled for the root user
Password policies for IAM users should have strong configurations
Statement: Review the IAM password policies and ensure that they have strong configurations.

Title: Unused IAM user credentials should be removed
Statement: Regularly review IAM users and remove unused credentials.

Title: Virtual MFA should be enabled for the root user
Password policies for IAM users should have strong configurations
Ensure IAM password policy requires at least one uppercase letter
Ensure IAM password policy requires at least one lowercase letter
Ensure IAM password policy requires at least one symbol
Ensure IAM password policy requires at least one number
Ensure IAM password policy requires minimum password length of 14 or greater
Ensure IAM password policy prevents password reuse
Ensure IAM password policy expires passwords within 90 days or less
Ensure a support role has been created to manage incidents with AWS Support
Statement: Create a support role in AWS for incident management.

Title: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users
Avoid the use of the root user
Statement: Review IAM users and policies to ensure that root user access is restricted and limited.

Title: IAM customer managed policies that you create should not allow wildcard actions for services
IAM user credentials unused for 45 days should be removed
Statement: Review IAM user credentials and remove any that have been unused for 45 days.

Title: Kinesis streams should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Ensure that all Kinesis streams are configured with encryption at-rest.

Title: IAM customer managed policies should not allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
IAM principals should not have IAM inline policies that allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
AWS KMS keys should not be deleted unintentionally
AWS KMS key rotation should be enabled
Statement: Review all KMS keys and enable key rotation if needed

Title: Lambda function policies should prohibit public access
Lambda functions should use supported runtimes
Statement: Review Lambda functions and ensure that only supported runtimes are being used.

Title: Lambda functions should be in a VPC
VPC Lambda functions should operate in more than one Availability Zone
Network Firewall policies should have at least one rule group associated
The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for full packets
The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for fragmented packets
Stateless network firewall rule group should not be empty
OpenSearch domains should have encryption at rest enabled
Statement: Ensure all OpenSearch domains have encryption at rest enabled.

Title: OpenSearch domains should be in a VPC
OpenSearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
Statement: Review all OpenSearch domains and configure encryption for data sent between nodes if not already enabled.

Title: OpenSearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
OpenSearch domains should have audit logging enabled
OpenSearch domains should have at least three data nodes
OpenSearch domains should have fine-grained access control enabled
Statement: Review all OpenSearch domains and enable fine-grained access control if needed.

Title: Connections to OpenSearch domains should be encrypted using TLS 1.2
Statement: Ensure that all connections to OpenSearch domains are encrypted using TLS 1.2.

Title: RDS snapshot should be private
Statement: Ensure all RDS snapshots are set to private to prevent unauthorized access.

Title: RDS DB Instances should prohibit public access, as determined by the PubliclyAccessible configuration
Statement: Review all RDS DB instances and disable PubliclyAccessible if needed, in order to prohibit public access.

Title: RDS DB instances should have encryption at-rest enabled
Statement: Review all RDS DB instances and turn on encryption at-rest if needed

Title: RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Review all RDS cluster and database snapshots and enable encryption at rest if necessary.

Title: RDS DB instances should be configured with multiple Availability Zones
Enhanced monitoring should be configured for RDS DB instances
Statement: Review RDS DB instances and configure enhanced monitoring if needed.

Title: RDS clusters should have deletion protection enabled
RDS DB instances should have deletion protection enabled
Statement: Review all RDS DB instances and enable deletion protection if needed.

Title: Database logging should be enabled
IAM authentication should be configured for RDS instances
RDS instances should have automatic backups enabled
IAM authentication should be configured for RDS clusters
RDS automatic minor version upgrades should be enabled
Statement: Review RDS instances and enable automatic minor version upgrades if not already enabled.

Title: Amazon Aurora clusters should have backtracking enabled
Statement: Review all Amazon Aurora clusters and enable backtracking if needed.

Title: RDS DB clusters should be configured for multiple Availability Zones
RDS DB clusters should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Statement: Review all RDS DB clusters and configure them to copy tags to snapshots.

Title: RDS DB instances should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Statement: Ensure that tags are copied to RDS DB instance snapshots as per the desired configuration.

Title: RDS instances should be deployed in a VPC
An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical cluster events
An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database instance events
An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database parameter group events
An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database security group events
RDS instances should not use a database engine default port
RDS Database Clusters should use a custom administrator username
Statement: Ensure that a custom administrator username is used for all RDS Database Clusters.

Title: RDS database instances should use a custom administrator username
Statement: Review all RDS DB instances and update the default administrator username to a custom one.

Title: RDS DB instances should be covered by a backup plan
Statement: Review all RDS DB instances and ensure that they are covered by a backup plan.

Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should prohibit public access
Statement: Review all Amazon Redshift clusters and configure their security groups to prohibit public access.

Title: Connections to Amazon Redshift clusters should be encrypted in transit
Statement: Review all connections to Amazon Redshift clusters and ensure encryption in transit is enabled.

Title: Amazon Redshift clusters should have automatic snapshots enabled
Amazon Redshift clusters should have audit logging enabled
Statement: Review all Amazon Redshift clusters and enable audit logging if needed.

Title: Amazon Redshift should have automatic upgrades to major versions enabled
Statement: Review all Amazon Redshift clusters and enable automatic upgrades to major versions if needed.

Title: Redshift clusters should use enhanced VPC routing
Amazon Redshift clusters should not use the default Admin username
Redshift clusters should not use the default database name
Statement: When creating a Redshift cluster, do not use the default database name.

Title: Redshift clusters should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Check all Redshift clusters and enable encryption at rest if it is not already enabled.

Title: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled
Statement: Review all S3 bucket settings and enable Block Public Access if it is not enabled

Title: S3 buckets should prohibit public read access
Statement: Review all S3 buckets and configure them to disallow public read access.

Title: S3 buckets should prohibit public write access
Statement: Review all S3 buckets and ensure public write access is disabled.

Title: S3 buckets should have server-side encryption enabled
Statement: Review all S3 buckets and turn on server-side encryption if needed.

Title: S3 buckets should require requests to use Secure Socket Layer
S3 permissions granted to other AWS accounts in bucket policies should be restricted
S3 buckets should have cross-Region replication enabled
S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled at the bucket-level
S3 bucket server access logging should be enabled
S3 buckets with versioning enabled should have lifecycle policies configured
S3 buckets should have event notifications enabled
S3 access control lists (ACLs) should not be used to manage user access to buckets
S3 buckets should have lifecycle policies configured
S3 buckets should use versioning
Statement: Review all S3 buckets and enable versioning if needed.

Title: S3 buckets should be configured to use Object Lock
Amazon SageMaker notebook instances should not have direct internet access
SageMaker notebook instances should be launched in a custom VPC
Users should not have root access to SageMaker notebook instances
Secrets Manager secrets should have automatic rotation enabled
Secrets Manager secrets configured with automatic rotation should rotate successfully
Remove unused Secrets Manager secrets
Statement: Review all Secrets Manager secrets and delete any that are no longer needed.

Title: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated within a specified number of days
SNS topics should be encrypted at-rest using AWS KMS
Logging of delivery status should be enabled for notification messages sent to a topic
Amazon SQS queues should be encrypted at rest
Statement: Review all Amazon SQS queues and enable encryption at-rest if needed.

Title: EC2 instances should be managed by AWS Systems Manager
EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have a patch compliance status of COMPLIANT after a patch installation
EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have an association compliance status of COMPLIANT
SSM documents should not be public
Statement: Ensure that all SSM documents are not publicly accessible.

Title: AWS WAF Classic Global Web ACL logging should be enabled
A WAF Regional rule should have at least one condition
A WAF Regional rule group should have at least one rule
A WAF Regional web ACL should have at least one rule or rule group
A WAF global rule should have at least one condition
A WAF global rule group should have at least one rule
A WAF global web ACL should have at least one rule or rule group
A WAFv2 web ACL should have at least one rule or rule group
AWS WAFv2 web ACL logging should be activated
